author: David Martosko
title: Black reporter clashes with Omarosa in Trump White House | Daily Mail Online
text: Extraordinary confrontation between Omarosa and African-American White House reporter as former 'Apprentice' star now in Trump's inner circle claims to have 'dossiers' on black journalists Trump aide Omarosa Manigault and reporter April Ryan clashed in a White House corridor on Monday Formerly friends, the two began feuding after Manigault hinted that Ryan may have been paid by Hillary Clinton's campaign; no evidence supports that Ryan said Manigault 'physically intimidated' her and warned that she was among a group of black journalists on whom the White House keeps 'dossiers' Press secretary Sean Spicer batted away that idea on Tuesday, saying it's 'absolutely not true' â€“ but joking that the opposition research was in a 'binder' Spicer's joke fell flat and there's no indication tensions have lessened Ryan was friendly to Clinton, judging from emails Wikileaks released following a hack of campaign chairman John Podesta She complimented the Democrat's hair, told her staff to 'kick but [sic]' in a debate, and advised the campaign about the need to 'sit down with black reporters fast' in order to burnish her image Published: 23:53 GMT, 14 February 2017 | Updated: 16:41 GMT, 15 February 2017 112 shares
